intro: Microlicia martiana, commonly known as the red-flowered microlicia, is a tropical shrub native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of bright red flowers that bloom throughout the year. Its flowers are typically visited by hummingbirds and other pollinators, contributing to its ecological significance. Microlicia martiana is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its vibrant blooms and compact growth habit.
